solution.p: To find the d-intercept, we set g = 0 and solve for d.
The d-intercept is (240, 0). To find the g-intercept, we set d = 0 and solve for g. g = 20 − \frac{1}{12}(\alert{0}) = 20 The g-intercept is (0, 20).

subsection.title: Meaning of the Intercepts
subsection.p: The intercepts of a graph give us information about the situation it models.

statement.p: What do the intercepts of the graph in the Example above tell us about the problem situation?

solution.p: The d-intercept tells us that when d = 240, g = 0, or that when Leon has traveled 240 miles, he has 0 gallons of gasoline left; the fuel tank is empty. The g-intercept tells us that when d = 0, g = 20, or that when Leon has traveled 0 miles, he has 20 gallons of gasoline left. The fuel tank holds 20 gallons when full.

subsection.title: General Form for a Linear Equation
subsection.p: The graphs of the equations we have seen so far are all portions of straight lines. For this reason such equations are called linear equations.

The order of the terms in the equation does not matter. For example, the equation in of
\amp C=5+3t \amp \amp \text{ can be written equivalently as } \amp -3t + C=5
and the equation in of that section,
\amp g=20-\frac{1}{12}d \amp \amp \text{ can be written as } \amp \frac{1}{12}d+g=20
This form of a linear equation, Ax +By = C, is called the general form.
